medical_history.chief_complaint: Failure to thrive and progressive postnatal growth failure.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was diagnosed with intrauterine growth restriction during pregnancy, leading to being born small for gestational age (SGA) at 40 weeks. Symptoms of growth failure became apparent at 11 months of age, with deterioration in height, weight, and head circumference. The patient's growth parameters remained consistently below standard deviations (SD) for age and sex throughout follow-up. GH treatment started at 3.2 years improved the growth rate initially but showed decrease in effectiveness over time, indicating partial GH resistance.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Intrauterine growth restriction, progressive postnatal growth failure, microcephaly, mild intellectual impairment.
medical_history.family_history: Patient was born to consanguineous parents; a healthy brother was reported with normal growth parameters.
medical_history.social_history: Patient had poor nutritional intake (630 kcal/d) and was described as very lean with insufficient food intake. There are no records of smoking or alcohol use.
